entry.title: Request to Create Separate Intercompany GL Accounts and Transaction Tagging
entry.content:
Currently, a single intercompany GL account is being used for all types of intercompany transactions (Due To / Due From) and is assigned in OBYA. This setup includes all intercompany activities such as fund transfers, allocations, expenses, and trade transactions.

For better clarity, proper classification, improved visibility, and easier reconciliation of intercompany balances, it is proposed to split the existing intercompany GL account into separate GL accounts under the main intercompany category.

The proposed classification is as follows:

  • Overheads / Common Costs
  • Rent
  • Trade
  • Expenses on Behalf Of
  • Fund Transfers

Each of the above categories should have a separate intercompany GL account maintained in SAP. These GLs should be configured to allow automatic clearing so that balances are clearly visible and reconcilable for each respective head across company codes.

In addition, appropriate transaction tagging should be defined based on the nature of the transaction. For example:

  • Fund transfer transactions should be posted and tagged to the newly created Fund Transfer intercompany GL.
  • Allocation and similar transactions should be posted to their respective relevant intercompany GLs.
  • Other intercompany transactions should follow the same logic based on the applicable GL classification.

Currently, only two intercompany GL accounts (Due To and Due From) are maintained and assigned in OBYA. The requirement is to maintain multiple intercompany GL accounts for the above-mentioned categories so that balances are separately managed, automatically cleared, and clearly reported per company code and transaction type.

Kindly review and advise on the feasibility and required SAP configuration changes to implement this structure.

Thanks & Regards

entry.title: Re: Run Statutory Reports app: GSTR3b & GSTR2B
entry.content:
Dear all,

 

Kindly ensure that statutory reports are properly configured using the ‚ÄúSetting Up Your Statutory Reporting‚Äù configuration activity. Please refer to the following SAP Help document for detailed guidance:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/4de200b26d5d42bbacae69c6bf6b9923/331dd0bd74fe480087e1deeec032aea0.html?locale=en-US&state=PRODUCTION&version=LATEST

 

For specific information related to the GSTR-3B report, please refer to the help document below:
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/634261119fec4d58970471f2c4a9a740/39974242269841778f2728247d22e9d7.html?version=LATEST&locale=en-US

 

Additionally, please review KBA 3428743 ‚Äì ‚ÄúTax Items data coming blank in GSTR-3B report, which provides guidance on configuring Tax Box Mappings for the GSTR-3B (Legacy) report.

 

It is also important to maintain correct source document types and ensure that only relevant information is included for GSTR-2A, IMS, and GSTR-2B consistency checks. These source document types are also considered for GSTR-3B reporting, particularly for Input Tax Credit (ITC) determination.

GSTR-2B is an auto-drafted ITC statement generated for every normal taxpayer based on data submitted by suppliers in their respective GSTR-1/IFF, GSTR-5 (Non-Resident Taxable Person), and GSTR-6 (Input Service Distributor) returns. The statement reflects the availability or non-availability of ITC for each supplier document. Following the introduction of IMS, it is also possible to regenerate the GSTR-2B statement.

For more information, please refer to the following SAP Help document:
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/634261119fec4d58970471f2c4a9a740/c9985d76aa004586937be8d85504900b.html?version=LATEST&locale=en-US

 

Best regards,

Atanu

SAP Support - S/4HANA Cloud

entry.title: Re: Croatia billing/posting date vs creation/issue date #...
entry.content:
Hi @Lakshmipathi, thanks so much for the quick reply. I have fed this back to our accountants, but they got this answer from ai.

Yes, the SAP ERP system is designed to support VAT posting by Tax Reporting Date or Tax Fulfillment Date, which is in accordance with Croatian VAT laws. SAP allows the separation of the invoice date from the date when the tax liability actually arose, using different dates in its modules: Tax Reporting Date/Tax Fulfillment Date: This is the key date for VAT calculation. In SAP, this date (often on the invoice line item) is used to determine the tax period to which the posting belongs, e.g. December 2025. Booking Date: This date determines the financial period in the general ledger (e.g. January 2026). Invoice Date: This is the date printed on the invoice itself (e.g. January 2, 2026).

How it works in practice within SAP: When entering an incoming or outgoing invoice, the user enters the invoice date, but it is crucial to correctly specify the tax date (date of service performance, 12/31/2025 in your case). SAP uses this tax date to generate legally required reports for the Tax Administration, such as VAT and U-RA forms, ensuring that the transaction is included in the correct tax period (December). SAP's Document and Reporting Compliance solutions are specifically tailored to Croatian regulations, including mandatory fiscalization 2.0 and e-invoices that came into effect in 2026, ensuring that the system can meet all local legal requirements.

In our S4Hana setup, we have configured the tax reporting date to be determined by the billing document date. Using a different date in service rendered date has no impact. But I notice we can change the Tax Reporting Date in Run Statutory Reports > Manage Tax Items for Legal Reporting and include a January invoice (Billing date 06.01.2026, Service Rendered Date 31/12/2025) in the December VAT return. Is this the solution we should go for? Although it still requires a journal to accrue the revenue in December rather than January

entry.title: Accessing a Build Work Zone Application Directly (Without Header)
entry.content:
Hi Folks,

Recently, I received the following requirement:

Requirement

The customer wants to access a single application in SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition directly, without navigating through the Work Zone home page.

Key expectations:

  • Users should be able to access a specific Work Zone application directly.

  • The Work Zone application may point to any backend application, such as:

    • Web Dynpro ABAP (WDA)

    • SAP UI5 / Fiori app

    • BW reports

    • Third-party applications

  • Users should only see the content of the backend application.

  • The Work Zone header should not be visible.

  • Typical use case:

    • A user receives an email notification (for example, for an approval).

    • Clicking Approve or Reject redirects the user directly to the relevant application.

 

Analysis

After analyzing the requirement, I identified two main parts:

  1. Hide or remove the Work Zone header

  2. Access the application directly using a semantic object and action

 

Solution

1. Hide the Work Zone Header

To hide the header area of the Work Zone, append the following URL parameter at the end of the URL:

sap-ushell-config=headerless

 

2. Access the Application Directly

To launch the application directly, append the semantic object and action to the URL:

##<semantic-object>-<action>

The semantic object and action can be obtained from the application configuration in Build Work Zone.

 

Final URL Example

https://<subaccount>.launchpad.cfapps.<region>.hana.ondemand.com/site/workzone-std-qa?sap-ushell-config=headerless#<semantic-object>-<action>

 

Result

With this configuration:

  • The Work Zone header is hidden.

  • Users are taken directly to the target backend application.

  • The experience is seamless and ideal for approval or notification-based use cases.

Below is the scren shot for reference:

 

I hope this helps others who are looking to access Work Zone applications directly without exposing the home page or header.

Please feel free to comment and share your thoughts.

 

Regards,
Rohit Gera

entry.title: How to get recorded working time or working days of timesheet in time off take rule?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We have time tracking enabled instance.

We have a requirement in employee central time off.

We have a group of employees who works continuously for 50 days without week offs. After working continuously for 48 to 50 days, then they will apply for a leave of 10 days, for that we have a leave type called "work break". 

If the employee failed to complete at least 48 days of work then system should restrict them while applying the leave.

Example:- If the employee wish to request leave from 1st November 2025 for 10 days, then that employee has to work for 48 to 50 days before the start date of the leave. then only the employee can request leave from 1st Nov 2025 to 10th Nov 2025. If the employee failed to work minimum 48 days before 1st Nov 2025 as per work schedule, then system should restrict the employee while requesting "Work Break Leave".

As we have timesheet implemented, the attendance data of the employee is getting recorded in the timesheet.

Please suggest me that how can I read the recorded working time or working days data from the timesheet data of the employee by using the time off take rule to check the attendance recorded in the period from (-50 days of 1st Nov 2025) to (1st Nov 2025).

Many Thanks

SAH

entry.title: Process Resource in SAP Digital Manufacturing: The Small Flag That Can Make or Break Your Shop Floor
entry.content:
Introduction

In SAP Digital Manufacturing, some of the most powerful behaviors are controlled by very small configuration switches, and the 'Process Resource' flag is a great example of that.

It defines whether a started SFC is owned by the resource or by the user ID who started it, which seems a minor detail, but can make all the difference in your process flow, as this single flag can give a lot of flexibility, enable team-based execution, and much more.

What is a 'Process Resource'?

The Process Resource flag controls who owns a started SFC. You have two options:

Process Resource = Yes

  • The SFC is assigned to the resource
  • One operator can start the SFC
  • A different operator can finish the SFC

Process Resource = No (default)

  • The SFC is assigned to the user ID
  • The same user who starts the SFC must also complete it

Example 1: Team-Based Workstation

You have a packing station where:

  • Operator A starts the SFC in the morning
  • Operator B takes over after shift change and finishes it

In this case, Process Resource must be = Yes.

Why?
Because the SFC is owned by the resource, not by Operator A.
Anyone working on that resource can continue the work.

This is how you enable:

  • Shift handovers
  • Team-based execution
  • Realistic shop floor flexibility

Example 2: Single-Operator Accountability

You have a quality inspection station where:

  • The same operator must perform the full inspection from start to finish
  • Full traceability per user is required

In this case, Process Resource should be = No.

Why?
Because now the SFC is locked to the user ID.
Only the user who started it can complete it.

This is perfect for:

  • Quality steps
  • Regulatory processes
  • Sensitive operations

IMPORTANT

Changing the Process Resource flag after SFCs have already been started can have serious implications.

For example:

  • If you change from Yes to No
  • Any SFC already started will now be locked to the original user
  • No other operator will be able to complete it

Result:

  • Operators get blocked
  • Production gets stuck
  • Confusion on the shop floor

So the rule is simple: Decide this upfront and avoid changing it mid-stream.

Conclusion

The 'Process Resource' flag may look like a small setting, but in reality, it is a strategic design decision.

It directly defines:

  • How flexible your shop floor is
  • How your operators collaborate
  • How realistic your scenarios feel
  • How smooth your shifts run

This is one of those details that separates an average setup from a truly well-designed, production-ready landscape.

Learn more at Manage Resources.

Do you want to see more content like this? Please live a Kudos!

If you have any questions, please check SAP Community Q&A Area, or comment down below.

Thanks,
Manoel Costa

entry.title: Update US Tax Rates error Valid from date of jur cd &1 is before valid from date in customizing
entry.content:
In Configuration Activity 101016 - Define Tax Codes for Sales and Purchases or App Upload Tax Rates (F2609) a tax rate needs to be created with validity date prior to that of existing tax rates. 

Error messages if an existing tax rate is changed in the past:

  1. Configuration Activity 101016 - Define Tax Codes for Sales and Purchases: ‚ÄúValid from date of jur cd &1 is before valid from date in customizing‚Äù.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Update US Tax Rates error Valid from date of jur cd &...
entry.content:
Changing tax rates in the past is always risky, as this will overwrite all future rates. This could lead to incorrect processing of already posted documents. Therefore, it is not allowed by default in the system. 

However, in certain situations, like 0% tax rates and no existing postings, the error messages can be disabled "-". Configuration activity "Message Control in Tax Area" (103887) is to be used to disable the messages 036 (needed for the App Upload Tax Rates (F2609)), 048 (needed for configuration activity ‚ÄúDefine Tax Codes for Sales and Purchases‚Äù (101016)) and 078 (needed for the tax rate import into the test/production system) for application area FOT_US_INT_TAX_CALC.

At least the entry for message 078 must already be present in the subsequent system before the tax rate changes are imported. If taxes have already been imported before disabling the message 078, the missing transport requests can be re-imported using the App Import Tax Codes after Transport (TAX_RATE_TRANS). This app only displays the transport requests with US tax rates that have not yet been imported. After import, the transport requests are deleted from the value help list.

Once the changes are made, it is recommended to set the messages back to error "E".

In the public cloud, changes to the finance tax rate must always be made in the customizing tenant and then transported to the other systems.

entry.title: Re: Generic IDoc Outbound flow in Cloud Integration Pipeline
entry.content:
@slava_kuzyakin I have requirement to use EOIO from CPI to SAP and I am trying to fill: ARCKEY=urn:sap.com:seq=<QueueID>-<QueueCounter>-< Date>-<ReconciliationIndicator>

I sent exactly this:

ARCKEY=urn:sap.com:seq=TEST_QUEUE-0000000001-20260106-Dummy

maybe I misunderstood something in note 1613719:

The components of the ID:

  • urn:sap.com:seq=: Prefix for identifying the ID for in order processing
  • <QueueID>: Queue name, length 32 characters The SAP systems use UUIDs as queue names. This is also recommended for external systems.
  • <QueueCounter>:  IDoc counter within the queue. The counter is defined as a field of the type NUMC and with the length 10.
  • <Date>: Date on which the predecessor IDoc was created in the sending system.
  • <ReconciliationIndicator>: Indicator for identifying IDocs that are exchanged for synchronization purposes. If this indicator is set, the IDoc is transferred to the application regardless of whether or not all of the predecessor IDocs have been successfully processed.

I am not sure if all 4 values are mandatory, what is the format of each filed and also how to store in CPI "table" with columns: queueName|QueueCounter|Date|ReconciliationIndicator

As I have dynamic queue name it makes it more difficult. 

My issue is that when I sent ARCKEY=urn:sap.com:seq=TEST_QUEUE-0000000001-20260106-Dummy IDOCs finished in S4 in status 66: IDoc must be processed later; expected: 0000000001 ; current:

entry.title: Re: Unable to find "Maintain Communication Users" or "SAP...
entry.content:
Hi,

 

This is expected behaviour in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition ‚Äì Trial.

According to SAP‚Äôs official trial description: https://www.sap.com/products/erp/s4hana/trial.html

the free trial provides a shared tenant with a limited, preconfigured scope, intended for exploring standard business processes only. Administrative and key-user capabilities are intentionally restricted.

Based on the trial scope described on the SAP page:

  • The trial runs in a shared environment, therefore system-wide administration is disabled
  • Key-user and admin activities are not supported. As a result, apps such as ‚ÄúMaintain Communication Users‚Äù, ‚ÄúCommunication Systems‚Äù, and ‚ÄúCommunication Arrangements‚Äù are not available
  • Integration with SAP BTP is not offered in this trial

This means that inbound communication scenarios cannot be fully configured in the shared trial, even though you can technically create a Communication Scenario in ADT.

The shared trial content and authorizations are fixed by SAP and cannot be extended or activated manually. This limitation is by design, not a configuration issue.

 

All the best, 

Elena P.

entry.title: Re: Organizaci√≥n de Servicio y estructura organizativa en...
entry.content:
Hi,

 

SAP Note 2696536 ‚Äì Unable to select Plant or Purchasing Organization when creating a Service Organization explains in detail the prerequisites for creating a Service Organization in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Access the link: https://me.sap.com/notes/2696536

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, the assignment between Plant and Sales Area (Sales Organization + Distribution Channel + Division) is 1:1, meaning:

  • A Plant can be assigned to only one Sales Area

  • A Sales Area can have only one Plant

This behavior is also clarified in SAP Note 3681728 ‚Äì Plant assignments to sales area is not reflected in ‚ÄúAssign Sales Organization ‚Äì Distribution Channel ‚Äì Plant‚Äù:

Access the link: https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3681728

For additional guidance on Service Organization creation, please refer to the SAP Help Portal documentation below:

  • https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/29cf986299714386847f4d4c9bb86994/919878e7de1b4fdd9ad093aaf4144763.html

  • https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/29cf986299714386847f4d4c9bb86994/f487a450daa94f5da93fb7049a125184.html

 

All the best,
Elena P.

entry.title: SAP GUI - Transaction Code - DBACOCKPIT (DB Size History)
entry.content:
last updated: 2026-01-06

Introduction
The article explains the SAP GUI ‚Äì TCODE (Transaction Code): DBACOCKPIT (DB Size History) usage in details.

SAP GUI

  • SAP Help Portal ‚Äì SAP GUI for Windows
  • SAP Community ‚Äì SAP GUI ‚Äì SAP GUI Family
  • 147519 ‚Äì Maintenance strategy / deadlines for SAP GUI for Windows / SAP GUI for Java

Description
You can display an overview of historical information about the disk space and memory consumption of the database.

DB Size History aggregates the following database metrics:

  • Memory used
  • Disk space used for data
  • Disk space used for database logs
  • Disk space used for trace files

Transaction Code:
DBACOCKPIT 

DBA Cockpit menu structure (Navigation Panel):
System Information > DB Size History

  • SAP Help Portal - DBA Cockpit for SAP HANA - Screen Layout in DBA Cockpit for SAP HANA

Screen: DB Size History
Based on the displayed data the questioned area can be identified easily. This is a good technique to visualize the issue and as a first step to be familiar with the actual situation.

Example:
The following example shows two identified issues.

  1. Continuous, stepwise increase in used disk space (increase and keep on same level for a while).
  2. In the last quarter rapid increase in used disk space (marked with red).

The next documents can be used handling the DISK usage issue:

  1. The constantly increasing disk space (used) belongs to the general data management area (archiving, data retention policy, etc.). Reference: 3348393 - Overview of the data management process in the context of SAP HANA and 3582156 - Archiving / Archive Strategies for table(s) from the perspective of the SAP HANA database
  2. Rapidly growing (used) disk space can be a specific issue. It can be caused by various reasons. E.g. one specific table started to grow rapidly. In this case the table can be identified by report "HANA_Tables_TopGrowingTables_Size_History" and "HANA_Tables_TopGrowingTables_Records_History". If table identified it can be checked further (3421144 - SQL Statement Collection: "HANA_Tables_DataCollector" report for SAP HANA).

Related SAP documentations
The following SAP documentations belongs to the topic.

  • 3006773 - How to check DB SIZE HISTORY
  • 2453269 - DB Size History for SAP HANA in DBACockpit

Other articles in this series
üîñ 3428763 - Bookmark of frequently used SAP GUI transaction codes for SAP HANA related investigations

Do you have further questions?
Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have question or observation regarding the article.
SAP Community for SAP GUI: https://community.sap.com/topics/gui

Contribution
If you find any missing information belongs to the topic, please let me know. I am happy to add the new content. My intention is to maintain the content continuously to keep the info up-to-date.

Release Information

Release DateDescription
2026.01.06First/initial Release of the SAP Blog Post documentation (Product Information).

entry.title: Re: Statistical Sales Condition in Margin Analysis should...
entry.content:
Hi,

The statistical indicator only ensures that the condition does not affect the net price in the sales document. It does not determine whether the value is treated as a cost or revenue in analytics.

Setting for the Pricing Condition Type

-> Plus/Minus field

When a billing document is created, statistical pricing conditions are transferred to Margin Analysis exactly with the sign defined in the condition type. Margin Analysis does not apply semantic interpretation (cost vs. revenue); instead, it evaluates the value purely based on its sign:

  • Positive value ‚Üí reported as favorable
  • Negative value ‚Üí reported as cost (unfavorable)

To ensure that a statistical condition is reported as a cost, the condition type must be configured with a minus sign.

 

-> Condition Category (e.g. G, S etc ) field

The Condition Category controls how the system determines the cost value:

  • Condition category G
    Accesses the valuation segment of the material master and determines either the standard cost or the moving average cost, depending on the material master setting.
  • Condition category S
    Always accesses the standard cost.
  • Condition category T
    Always accesses the moving average cost.

 

Setting for the Pricing Procedure Configuration

Please also review the Pricing Procedure configuration:

  • Ensure the Statistical checkbox is selected for the condition type in the pricing procedure.
  • Verify that the correct pricing procedure is assigned.
  • Depending on the business scenario, maintain the appropriate Requirement and Alternative Calculation Type. (In the provided example, Requirement 4 ‚Äì Cost is used.)

 

Official SAP Documentation (Public Cloud)

  • Using Statistical Condition Types
    https://learning.sap.com/courses/configuring-pricing-in-sap-s-4hana-sales/using-statistical-condition-types
  • Statistical Sales Conditions ‚Äì SAP S/4HANA Cloud
    https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/e6175604fc874bfe84aa14d2f9ae1fbd/9b499aafdc2b423c9e2dc0014f9b9bd6.html

 

Best Regards,

Elena P.

entry.title: BIB Query IT0001 WS_4

entry.title: Introducing the SAP Activate for SAP Business Network for Logistics roadmap
entry.content:
There is no better way to start the year and set the tone for 2026 than with exciting news: we are happy to announce the release of the SAP Activate for SAP Business Network for Logistics roadmap.

Over the past months, we have been focusing on how to best support customers who have acquired SAP Business Network for Logistics in implementing the solution successfully, efficiently, and with confidence. The result is a carefully designed roadmap that guides implementation teams without overwhelming them with unnecessary complexity.

Our goal was clear: create a roadmap that covers the full scope of the solution, including its three core products ‚Äî Freight Collaboration, Global Track and Trace, and Intelligent Insights ‚Äî while remaining intuitive, practical, and easy to navigate.

Why SAP Business Network for Logistics?

The SAP Business Network for Logistics solution offers an opportunity to establish a better collaboration with shippers and carriers to optimize end-to-end logistics processes, improve operations, get real-time insights into logistics execution, increase on-time deliveries and mitigate supply risk.

With the new SAP Activate roadmap, customers now have a structured, best-practice-driven approach to turn these capabilities into tangible business value.

What to Expect from the SAP Activate Roadmap?

The roadmap follows the familiar SAP Activate phases and provides clear guidance at every step of the implementation journey, as illustrated below:

Throughout all phases, the roadmap is designed to be easy to navigate and adapt to your specific project needs. Using the Road Map Viewer, you can filter tasks and deliverables by Workstreams, Products, Tags, or Roles to quickly focus on what matters most for your implementation. When a SAP Business Network for Logistics product requires specific procedures or essential accelerators, the related tasks are clearly identified under the ‚ÄúProduct‚Äù category. For example, as you can see below, within "SBN for Logistics for Freight Collaboration" filter, you will find dedicated tasks covering initial access, self-enablement, Fit-to-Standard workshops, integration, and configuration.

To support execution beyond planning, the roadmap is also available in SAP Cloud ALM, where it can be selected as a project template as illustrated in the following image. This enables teams to track progress, assign tasks to responsible stakeholders, manage timelines, mark tasks as Not Relevant when applicable, and monitor the implementation end to end.

We encourage you to explore the SAP Activate for SAP Business Network for Logistics roadmap and share your feedback, either through this blog post or directly via the Road Map Viewer. Your input helps us continuously refine our roadmaps and ensure they remain relevant and valuable throughout your implementation journey.

entry.title: Re: Error when extending Standard CDS view with UNION ALL
entry.content:
Dear @Praveen_Kumar40266,

In Public Cloud you won‚Äôt be able to extend P_ObjPgMaintOrderAndOperation the way you tried for two reasons that both block extensions:

  1. It‚Äôs a P_... projection view meant to serve a specific Fiori Object Page. CDS view entity extensions can‚Äôt append fields to CDS projection views
  2. Extending a CDS view entity with set operators is only possible if SAP modeled the view with the proper enhancement category needs #UNION in the view enhancement category. If SAP didn‚Äôt you‚Äôll get exactly the contains union extends are not allowed type of error and you can‚Äôt change that in Public Cloud

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/doc/abapdocu_latest_index_htm/latest/en-US/ABENCDS_EXTEND_VIEW_ENTITY.html

So the practical options in Public Cloud are:

Option 1.

If your goal is show/maintain additional fields in the standard Maintenance Order / Operation apps, this is the supported path:

  • Use the Custom Fields app to create fields in the right business context: Maintenance Order / Operation
  • Publish the field and enable it for UI usage and OData/reporting if needed
  • Then add it to the UI via the app extensibility capabilities for the relevant maintenance apps

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/3ccb50e724b045508fea8b2cf1774b2b.html

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/57909455bf7c4fdd8bcf48d76c1eae33.html

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/55a7cb346519450cb9e6d21c1ecd6ec1/20a91308a4304cc297e2f2e36198c616.html

https://help.sap.com/docs/build-service/build-service-guide/using-extensibility-wizard

IMPORTANT:

In Public Cloud you normally do not bring AUFK-ZZ fields into a standard view instead you create YY1_... custom fields in the business context and let SAP propagate them

Option 2.

If you need extra fields for extraction/reporting/integration not necessarily inside the standard object page data source:

  • Create a Custom CDS View based on released VDM views for Maintenance Orders/Operations instead of using the P_... object page projection view as your base
  • Expose it as OData or use it in Custom Analytical Queries app

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/c0c54048d35849128be8e872df5bea6d/8573b810511948c8a99c0672abc159aa.html

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/e30de6eae4d24d70b65996ac8ff88848.html

This is often the cleanest approach when the standard projection view is closed for extension

Option 3.

If you must combine extra data that you can‚Äôt get into the standard apps data source build a side-by-side app/service on BTP and consume the released APIs. This aligns with the Public Cloud extensibility model

More details below:

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-s-4hana-cloud-public-edition-developer-extensibility-sap-s-4hana-cloud/ba-p/13570390

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/7139c1648de84c0bbd7637589ed7c92a.html

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/2a17a3e1525f4f46a9c5156bd2d3bc87.html

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: SAP FOR DUMMIES #1 - ¬øQu√© es y por qu√© se convirti√≥ en el "as bajo la manga" profesional?
entry.content:
¬°Hola! Soy @MatiasLemos, Consultor SAP apasionado por la tecnolog√≠a, automatizaci√≥n e inteligencia artificial.

¬°Bienvenido a esta nueva seccion llamada SAP for Dummies!

El objetivo es contarte todo el camino desde 0 hasta que puedas volverte Consultor SAP en Argentina o que puedas trabajar correctamente con SAP en cualquiera de sus productos.

Si pasaste m√°s de cinco minutos navegando en LinkedIn o revisando portales de empleo, es casi seguro que te cruzaste con estas tres letras: SAP (Systemanalyse Programmentwicklung) o mas facil "Sistemas, Aplicaciones y Productos".

A menudo se lo percibe como un sistema complejo y algo distante, reservado solo para ingenieros o especialistas en IT. Sin embargo, en el ecosistema empresarial actual ‚Äîdesde las grandes multinacionales hasta las empresas locales con proyecci√≥n‚Äî, SAP es el idioma en el que se habla de eficiencia. Pero, ¬øde qu√© se trata realmente y por qu√© hoy parece ser el centro de todas las conversaciones de carrera?

El cerebro detr√°s de las organizaciones que funcionan

Para explicarlo de forma sencilla: imaginate una empresa como una gran orquesta. Ten√©s a la gente de finanzas, compras, ventas, recursos humanos y log√≠stica. Si cada √°rea toca su propia partitura sin mirar al resto, el resultado es puro ruido.

SAP es el director de esa orquesta. Es un sistema de gesti√≥n (ERP) que permite que todas las √°reas de una compa√±√≠a compartan la misma informaci√≥n en tiempo real. Si un vendedor en Buenos Aires cierra un trato, el dep√≥sito en C√≥rdoba ya sabe que tiene que preparar el env√≠o y el √°rea contable ya tiene la factura lista para procesar. Todo fluye, sin "tel√©fonos descompuestos" ni archivos de Excel que no coinciden entre departamentos.

El dato: No es casualidad que las empresas m√°s importantes del pa√≠s y del mundo lo elijan. SAP aporta la estructura y la trazabilidad que un negocio necesita para escalar de manera profesional.

¬øPor qu√© hay tanto ruido alrededor de SAP en este 2026?

No es una moda pasajera; estamos atravesando un momento de transformaci√≥n estructural por dos razones clave:

  1. La evoluci√≥n tecnol√≥gica: Miles de compa√±√≠as est√°n migrando sus sistemas a la nube (espec√≠ficamente a SAP S/4HANA). Este recambio genera una demanda de talento sin precedentes para liderar esos procesos de cambio.

  2. Un pasaporte global: El perfil profesional argentino es muy valorado afuera por su capacidad de an√°lisis. Saber SAP permite trabajar en proyectos globales desde cualquier rinc√≥n del pa√≠s, con una proyecci√≥n de carrera y una competitividad salarial que pocos sectores ofrecen hoy.

Una oportunidad de "reinvenci√≥n" para todos

Ac√° es donde se pone interesante para quienes buscan un nuevo rumbo. Existe el mito de que para trabajar en el mundo SAP hay que ser un experto en programaci√≥n. Nada m√°s alejado de la realidad.

  • Para el estudiante: Salir al mercado laboral con conocimientos de SAP es, literalmente, saltarse varios casilleros. Te da un perfil ejecutivo y una ventaja competitiva desde el primer d√≠a.

  • Para el profesional que busca un cambio: Pod√©s capitalizar toda tu experiencia previa. Un contador puede especializarse en el m√≥dulo de Finanzas (FI); alguien que viene de procesos industriales, en Producci√≥n (PP) o Materiales (MM). No est√°s empezando de cero, est√°s d√°ndole un "upgrade" premium a tu trayectoria.

En conclusi√≥n

Involucrarse en el ecosistema SAP no es solo aprender a usar un software; es entender la l√≥gica de los negocios modernos. En un mercado tan competitivo como el nuestro, donde a veces parece que "remamos en dulce de leche", contar con formaci√≥n en SAP es, posiblemente, la inversi√≥n con mayor retorno que pod√©s hacer en tu futuro.

No hace falta ser un experto en sistemas para empezar. Solo hace falta curiosidad para entender c√≥mo se mueve el motor de las empresas hoy en d√≠a.

Si te quedo alguna duda o consulta por favor dejala ac√° abajo para poder ayudarte o contactame via Linkedin!

https://www.linkedin.com/in/matiassap/

Muchas gracias por leer y ser parte de la familia SAP Community Argentina.
